alert.note: Alert for Hempstead; Miller (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 2:22PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hempstead, southeastern Miller, Lafayette and northwestern Columbia Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 222 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Garland, or 8 miles southwest of Lewisville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Magnolia, Stamps, Waldo, Lewisville, Fouke, Buckner, Garland, Canfield, Smithland, Mount Vernon, Patmos, Lerch, McKamie, Cornelius, Spirit Lake, Piney Grove and Mars Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
